The Cornell Graduate School is committed to working with prospective students and providing assistance with the graduate school exploration and application processes. Explore our recruiting schedule to identify opportunities to speak with a Cornell representative at an event.  We will continue to add events, dates, and updated registration links to the recruitment calendar below as they become available. If you are a prospective student who would like to schedule a Zoom meeting with Anitra McCarthy, our assistant dean for access and recruitment, please email considergrad@cornell.edu to schedule a time. Land Acknowledgement Cornell University is located on the traditional homelands of the Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ (the Cayuga Nation). The Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ are members of the Hodinǫ̱hsǫ́:nih Confederacy, an alliance of six sovereign Nations with a historic and contemporary presence on this land. The Confederacy precedes the establishment of Cornell University, New York state, and the United States of America. We acknowledge the painful history of Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ dispossession, and honor the ongoing connection of Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ people, past and present, to these lands and waters. This land acknowledgment has been reviewed and approved by the traditional Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ leadership.
